intro: Tissa fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered tissa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Tissa fasciculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
